page.title: 13FARMING,SHEEP
page.content: Because the emphasis is now upon the production of fat lambs, certain asp- -ects of flock management and breed- ing policy arise from this considerat -ion. Thus there are no wether flocks on any of these farms whereas formerly the Cnewr Company ran several on diff- erent parts of the estate, purely for wool production. The choice of breed has been the cross between a Welsh Mountain ewe and a Cheviot ram, which became known as the BRECKNOCK HILL CHEVIOT sheep and is now accepted as a separate breed. This is a dual pur- pose sheep suitable for both meat and wool and preferred because they thrive on this kind of land and in this climate. Today there is increasing enthusiasm for crossing the BHC ewe with a Suffolk ram because of the bigger lambs which result.
